duties_responsibilities.duty: Plan and prepare lessons and instructional materials following curriculum guidelines in American Sign Language and English.
Instruct students in various subjects using American Sign Language and English.
Confer with parents, testing specialists, and other administrators to develop individual educational plans for students.
Prepare, administer, and score academic tests and records results.
Meet and confer with parents and supervisors to discuss students' academic and behavioral attitudes and achievements.
Assist in selecting appropriate textbooks and learning materials.
Participate in curriculum development and maintain updated lesson plans as prescribed by the curriculum.
Intercede in emergency situations as required and maintain order in the classroom.
Attend departmental and faculty meetings and perform other duties as assigned.

education_certification.credential: Special Education Certification and Master's degree in Deaf Education or childhood education preferred.
Eligibility for NYS certification as a Teacher of the Deaf; Special Needs.
Ability to successfully complete a Sign Language Proficiency Interview (SLPI) at the proficiency level defined for each job position as determined by SMSD.
Successful training in behavior management programs including TCI (Therapeutic Crisis Intervention).
Working With Disabled/Medically Fragile Children and Working With Children specialized training.
